suffodio: <entryFree id="n46441" type="main" key="suffo^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fŏdĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>fōdi, fossum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dig</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pierce underneath; to pierce</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bore through; to dig under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undermine</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): ilia equis suffodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inguina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <trans><tr>to stab in the belly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffosso equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:671" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 671</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices frumenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 21, 50, § 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:33:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 33, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 104</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vineas expediunt suffodiendis muris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: Alexandria<cb n="SUFF" />  est fere tota suffossa, <hi rend="ital">undermined</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 5, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">a cuniculis subfossum in Hispaniā oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 29, 43, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus subfossae fluctibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacella suffossa, incensa,</quote> <trans><tr>sapped</tr>, <tr>overthrown</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes suffossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffossio: <entryFree id="n46442" type="main" key="suffossi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffossĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suffodio</etym>, <sense id="n46442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a digging under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undermining</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:51:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 51, 58</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in <number>plur.</number>, concr., <hi rend="ital">mines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl> (dub.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipsum solum subfossionibus tremeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 49:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 49, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffossus: <entryFree id="n46443" type="main" key="suffossus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffossus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of suffodio.</entryFree>
suffraenatio: <entryFree id="n46444" type="main" key="suffraena_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffraenātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. suffrenatio.</entryFree>
suffragatio: <entryFree id="n46445" type="main" key="suffra_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffrāgātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suffragor</etym>, <sense id="n46445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a voting for one</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffrage</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">suffragationem, observantiam, et gratiam tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 18, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sublata sunt studia, exstinctae suffragationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in consule declarando multum etiam apud universum populum Romanum auctoritatis habet suffragatio militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:18:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 18, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">justa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec potestas nec suffragatio horum valuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 44, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 24:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 15</bibl></cit>, ext. 2. —With <hi rend="ital">gen. - obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragationem consulatus perdere,</quote> <trans><tr>the recommendation to the consulship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 65:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 65, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffragator: <entryFree id="n46446" type="main" key="suffra_ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffrāgātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who votes for another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a supporter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partisan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffragator</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">suffragatorum comparatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 21, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historicis notior, suffragatoribus obscurior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex fucosis firmi suffragatores evadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 9:35" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus in petendis honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 17, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:92:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 92, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">competitoris sui suffragatorem agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidati laborare desiimus: suffragatores incipimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 17:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 17, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.-obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesturae,</quote> <trans><tr>for the office of quæstor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:28:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 28, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46446.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a favorer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supporter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te et suffragatores tuos ulciscar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter studia suffragatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum suffragatore suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 20, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 16, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suffragatorius: <entryFree id="n46447" type="hapax" key="suffra_ga_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffrāgātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the support of a candidate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recommendatory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffragatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non brevis et suffragatoria, sed firma et perpetua amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 7:26" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 7, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffragatrix: <entryFree id="n46448" type="main" key="suffra_ga_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffrāgātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suffragator</etym>, <sense id="n46448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> (female) <hi rend="ital">favorer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supporter</hi> (late Lat.): nec adfuit (Minerva) suffragatricibus suis, Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 18, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
suffraginosus: <entryFree id="n46449" type="hapax" key="suffra_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffrāgĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>suffrago</etym>, <sense id="n46449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">diseased in the hough</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pastern</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:38:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 38, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffragium: <entryFree id="n46450" type="main" key="suffra_gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffrāgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perh. kindr. with suffrago, and therefore, prop., the pasternbone; cf. Wunder, Var. Lect. p. 169; hence, transf.</etym>, publicists' and jurid. t. t., <sense id="n46450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a votingtablet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ballot</hi> (syn. tabella), and in gen., <hi rend="ital">a vote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffrage</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n46450.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicam et versabor in re difficili, suffragia magistratu mandando aut reo judicando clam an palam ferre melius esset ... Ego in istā sum sententia, quā te fuisse semper scio, nihil ut fuerit in suffragiis voce melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:15:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitiis aediliciis suffragium ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de ejus capite, liberis, fortunis omnibus, conductos et sicarios suffragium ferre et eam legem putare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:18:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 18, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferunt suffragia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:31:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 31, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te suffragium tulisse in illā lege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum diribentur suffragia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragia aut scita multitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:16:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine suffragio populi aedilitatem gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragiis tres ex tribus generibus creati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:51:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 51, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii suffragium ineunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centurias in suffragium mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vobismet ipsis per suffragia uti praesides olim, nunc dominos destinatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 6</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">ut suffragia non in multitudinis, sed in locupletium potestate essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=334" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 334</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">libera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:211" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacita,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>secret voting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 20, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 25, 1</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n46450.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46450.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The right of voting right of suffrage</hi>: populi esse, non senatus,<pb n="1793" /> <cb n="SUFF" />  suffragium, quibus velit, impartiri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 36, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si suffragium detur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut populus Romanus suffragio privaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod interrogem, quem nemo congressu, nemo suffragio, nemo luce dignum putet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragia populo reddere,</quote> <trans><tr>the elections</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 16</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46450.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a decision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opinion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetor suffragio tuo et compotorum tuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 17, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(apes) concorde suffragio deterrimos (reges) necant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 16, § 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46450.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a favorable decision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approbation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">applause</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ventosae plebis suffragia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voto et suffragio prosequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:24 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 24 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dentatus vel numerosissima suffragia habet,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>very many authors who award to him the palm of bravery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 28, 29, § 101</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffrago: <entryFree id="n46451" type="main" key="suffra_go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffrāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub-frag, frango</etym>. <sense id="n46451.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the ham</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hock</hi> of a quadruped's hind leg (opp. armus): <cit><quote lang="la">articulum suffraginis contingere (cf. poples),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffraginum artus in aversum flectunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 45, 101, § 248</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:15:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 15, 2</bibl>. —Rarely of birds: <cit><quote lang="la">aves ut quadripedes alas in priora curvant, suffraginem in posteriora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 102, § 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquilae pedes evellunt in aversum a suffragine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 6, 18, § 54</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46451.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a shoot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spray</hi> of a vine: <cit><quote lang="la">suboles, quam rustici suffraginem vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46452" type="main" key="suffra_go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffrāgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = suffragor. <sense id="n46452.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vote for</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 468, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46452.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> </sense><sense id="n46452.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To agree with</hi>, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 468, 7</bibl> (Com. Fragm. 106 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n46452.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To proceed favorably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 3</bibl></cit> Esd. 6, 10.</sense></entryFree>
suffragor: <entryFree id="n46453" type="main" key="suffra_gor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffrāgor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n46453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [suffragium], publicists' t. t., <hi rend="ital">to vote for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to support with one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s vote and interest.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46453.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: si nihil erit praeter ipsorum suffragium, tenue est; <cit><quote lang="la">si, ut suffragantur, nihil valent gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:34:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 34, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragandi libido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:15:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convenerant undique, non suffragandi modo sed etiam spectandi causā P. Scipionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:38:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 38, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46453.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to be favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recommend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> (class.; syn.: faveo, studeo). </sense><sense id="n46453.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus suffragata domino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 138</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi Hortensius suffragatur, me oppugnat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi videris fratrem laudando suffragari tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui legi istius spes falsa et insignis impudentia maxime suffragatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:69:section=178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 69, § 178</bibl></cit>: a te peto, ut dignitati meae suffrageris, Planc. ap <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 7, 2</bibl>: laudi nostrae, Lentul. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 14, 4</bibl>: huic consilio suffragabatur etiam illa res, quod, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 61</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas defuncti ei sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:95" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronuntiatio, cui suffragatur vox facilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46453.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunā suffragante videris res maximas consecutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eximiam gloriam et dignitatem esse oportet in eo, quem homines ignoti nullis suffragantibus honore afficiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 7:28" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragante Theramene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si memoria suffragatur, tempus non defuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satius est se excutere et non suffragari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 118:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 118, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffrenatio: <entryFree id="n46454" type="main" key="suffre_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-frēnātĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">suffraen-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>freno</etym>, <sense id="n46454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a binding down fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cementing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 49, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">globus multā suffrenatione devinctus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffrendens: <entryFree id="n46455" type="hapax" key="suffrendens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-frendens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [frendo], <sense id="n46455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gnashing a little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor inflatā cervice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffrico: <entryFree id="n46456" type="main" key="suffri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-frĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rub underneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rub down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rub</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wipe off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:23:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 23, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:25:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 25, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:30:2" default="NO">12, 30, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palpebras medicamentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffrigide: <entryFree id="n46457" type="main" key="suffri_gi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffrīgĭdē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. suffrigidus.</entryFree>
suffrigidus: <entryFree id="n46458" type="main" key="suffri_gi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-frīgĭdus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather cold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">frigid</hi> (post-class. and very rare); <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: argumentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 11, 4</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">suffrīgĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">rather coldly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">frigidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis minute ac prope etiam suffrigide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:9:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffringo: <entryFree id="n46459" type="main" key="suffringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fringo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>frango</etym>, <sense id="n46459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">talos alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 8, 8</bibl>: crura alicui, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa ejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 26, 32</bibl></cit>. <cb n="SUFF" /></sense></entryFree>
suffrondeo: <entryFree id="n46460" type="main" key="suffronde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-frondĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put forth leaves</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. Serm. Mai, 3.</sense></entryFree>
suffugio: <entryFree id="n46461" type="main" key="suffu^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fŭgĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>fūgi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n46461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flee away</hi> (rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n46461.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodes vigilesque suffugere in tecta coëgit (imber),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46461.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flee from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avoid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escape</hi> a person or thing: <cit><quote lang="la">manuum tactum et ictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 360</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consularem orare conantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffugium: <entryFree id="n46462" type="main" key="suffu^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffŭgĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>suffugio</etym>, <sense id="n46462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place beneath which one flies</hi> for shelter from rain, etc., <hi rend="ital">a shelter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covert</hi> (not anteAug.). </sense><sense id="n46462.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nisi suffugium nimbos vitantibus essem? Ov. de Nuce, 119: subterranei specus suffugium hiemi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propinqua suffugia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffugia adversus perpetuum caeli rigorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:11:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffugium nullum aut imbris aut solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferarum imbriumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46462.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a refuge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remedy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec deverticula suffugia sunt infirmitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urgentium malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 196, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffulcio: <entryFree id="n46463" type="main" key="suffulci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fulcĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>fulsi, fultum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prop underneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to underprop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prop up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> (mostly ante- and post-class.; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n46463.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus paribus suffulta columnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxillas et cervices pulvillis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 248, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectica Syris suffulta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>borne</tr>, <tr>carried</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:3:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi suffulcis firmiter, Non potes subsistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis imum tegat suffulta latus,</quote> <trans><tr>lying on it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 105" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46463.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">propterea capitur cibus, ut suffulciat artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:868" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 868</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:951" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 951</bibl></cit>. (In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 54</bibl>, the correct read. is suffigit; v. Ritschl ad h. l.)</sense></entryFree>
suffulgeo: <entryFree id="n46464" type="main" key="suffulge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fulgĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gleam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shine beneath</hi>: tum fit ut umor aquae suffulgeat, Poët. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 2, p. 311</bibl> Burm.</sense></entryFree>
suffultura: <entryFree id="n46465" type="main" key="suffultu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffultūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suffulcio</etym>, <sense id="n46465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a propping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">columnae suffulturae solacio nudatae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffultus: <entryFree id="n46466" type="main" key="suffultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of suffulcio.</entryFree>
suffumigatio: <entryFree id="n46467" type="hapax" key="suffu_mi^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fūmĭgātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sūbf-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suffumigo</etym>, <sense id="n46467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fumigating from below</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
suffumigo: <entryFree id="n46468" type="main" key="suffu_mi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fūmĭgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fumigate from below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to suffumigate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex alvo apes minus frequentes evadunt, suffumigandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulvam sulphure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 20 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa rore marino vel lauro vel myrto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:25:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia albā cerā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 52, 16</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffumigare expedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffumo: <entryFree id="n46469" type="hapax" key="suffu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fūmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to smoke</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reek a little;</hi> trop., <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 29, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suffundatus: <entryFree id="n46470" type="hapax" key="suffunda_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fundātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [2. fundo], <sense id="n46470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">built under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laid as a foundation</hi>: lapidibus suffundatis, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 48, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suffundo: <entryFree id="n46471" type="main" key="suffundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fundo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>fūdi, fūsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour below</hi> or <hi rend="ital">underneath; to pour into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among; to pour over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon; to overspread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffuse</hi> (mostly ante-class. and postAug.). </sense><sense id="n46471.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46471.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">animum esse cordi suffusum sanguinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua suffunditur,</quote> <trans><tr>flows underneath</tr>, <tr>diffuses itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:26:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 26, 1</bibl></cit> (al. adfunditur): <cit><quote lang="la">intumuit suffusā venter ab undā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from dropsy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:215" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mane suffundam aquolam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare (i. e. aquam marinam) vinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merum in os mulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:38:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 38, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46471.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n46471.4" n="1" level="3"> Of tears, etc., <hi rend="ital">to suffuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fill</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis oculos suffusa nitentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tepido suffundit lumina rore (i. e. lacrimis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 360</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus suffusus lumina flammā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:368" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 368</bibl></cit>: oculi, qui ad alienam lippitudinem et ipsi suffunduntur, <hi rend="ital">become suffused</hi> (with tears), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quas ille voces lacrimis et multo pudore suffunditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:2:8" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46471.5" n="2" level="3"> Of other fluids, etc., <hi rend="ital">to tinge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imbue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">color</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agricola et minio suffusus rubenti,</quote> <trans><tr>stained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:55" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cruore suffunduntur oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>become bloodshot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 24, § 49</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">suffusi cruore oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 126</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a reverse construction: sanguis oculis suffusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodest felle suffusis,</quote> <trans><tr>for those affected with jaundice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 21, 30, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcera alte suffusa medullis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suffusa bilis,</quote> <trans><tr>jaundice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 26, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cb n="SUGG" /> lingua est suffusa veneno, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:777" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 777</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sales suffusi felle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:565" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(nebulae) suffundunt suā caelum caligine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calore suffusus aether,</quote> <trans><tr>suffused</tr>, <tr>intermingled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 21, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hyperionis orbem Suffundi maculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:121" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 121</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46471.6" n="3" level="3"> Of blushes, etc., <hi rend="ital">to redden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blush</hi>, etc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">littera suffusas quod habet maculosa lituras,</quote> <trans><tr>blurred</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of a blush: (Luna) si virgineum suffuderit ore ruborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffunditur ora rubore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">roseo suffusa rubore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Masinissae rubore suffusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum rubore suffundere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Pan. Theod. 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sancti viri est suffundi, si virginem viderit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 48</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46471.7" n="4" level="3"> Prov.: aquam frigidam suffundere, <hi rend="ital">to throw cold water upon</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">to calumniate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inveigh against</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 36</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46471.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(metus) omnia suffundens mortis nigrore,</quote> <trans><tr>covering</tr>, <tr>overspreading</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibo vires ad feturam,</quote> <trans><tr>to supply</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:8:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus in aliquem malevolentiā suffusus,</quote> <trans><tr>overspread</tr>, <tr>filled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>. — Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">suffūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">blushing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bashful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">modest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffusior sexus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 38 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
suffuror: <entryFree id="n46472" type="hapax" key="suffu_ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fūror</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n46472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to steal secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to steal away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffuror, suppilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffuscens: <entryFree id="n46473" type="spur" key="suffuscens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffuscens</orth>, false read. for suffundens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 39</bibl>.</entryFree>
suffusculus: <entryFree id="n46474" type="main" key="suffuscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffuscŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n46474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [suffuscus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat brown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brownish</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">homines Aegyptii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 16, 23</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 120, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suffuscus: <entryFree id="n46475" type="hapax" key="suffuscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fuscus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat brown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brownish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dusky</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">margarita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
suffusio: <entryFree id="n46476" type="main" key="suffu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suff-ūsĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suffundo</etym>, <sense id="n46476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pouring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spreading into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pouring over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a suffusion</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n46476.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <trans><tr>an infusion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cucumeris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46476.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., of diseases. </sense><sense id="n46476.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A spreading</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fellis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the jaundice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 49, § 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46476.4" n="2" level="3"> Suffusio oculorum (oculi); and often <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> suffusio, <hi rend="ital">opacity of the cornea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cataract</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 1, 2, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:33" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 4, 14, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:114" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 11, 27, § 114</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n46476.5" n="3" level="3"> Suffusio pedis, <hi rend="ital">a disease of the feet of animals</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 38 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <trans><tr>inflammation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:23:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 23, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffusorium: <entryFree id="n46477" type="hapax" key="suffu_so_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffūsōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel for pouring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pitcher</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 2, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Zach. 4, 12</bibl>; cf.: suffusorium <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/xusis,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
suffusus: <entryFree id="n46478" type="main" key="suffu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffūsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from suffundo.</entryFree>
sugambri: <entryFree id="n46479" type="main" key="Su^gambri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭgambri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Sigambri.</entryFree>
sugdiani: <entryFree id="n46480" type="main" key="Sugdi^a_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sugdĭāni</orth>, v. Sogdiani.</entryFree>
suggero: <entryFree id="n46481" type="main" key="sugge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sug-gĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>), <itype>gessi, gestum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay under</hi>, etc. (class., esp. in the trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n46481.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam costis aëni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 463</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem fornace succensā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46481.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To heap up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">build</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 8; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">celsis suggesta theatra columnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:644" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 644</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46481.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afford</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi> ( = praebeo, suppedito, ministro): <cit><quote lang="la">cur tu his rebus sumptum suggeris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum apparatus, Auct. B. Alex. 3, 1: cibum animalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitias alimentaque (tellus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feras silvae affatim suggerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ructanti pinnas rubentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 8</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliae (apes) struunt, aliae suggerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46481.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to afford</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiae flammam ac materiam criminibus suis suggerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suggeram quae vendatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam interrogationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 8</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46481.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sincipitamenta porcina, quae anteposita in mensā mihi bulimum suggerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit> Ritschl (MSS. milvina; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Brix ad loc.): aut Druso ludus est suggerendus aut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>is to be put upon</tr>, <tr>imposed upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 44, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46481.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To suggest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prompt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring to mind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoties aequitas restitutionem suggerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:6:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 6, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (res) suggerit, ut Italicarum rerum esse credantur eae res,</quote> <trans><tr>reminds</tr>, <tr>admonishes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:35" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 28, 5, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam de republicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 66:2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 66, 2</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">suggerente conjuge,</quote> <trans><tr>at the instigation of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 41:11" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 41, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suggerente irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:ib. 12:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46481.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To assign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">add</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjoin</hi>: huic incredibili<pb n="1794" /> <cb n="SUGG" />  sententiae ratiunculas suggerit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiam argumentorum singulis generibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmamenta causae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 81, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba, quae desunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26, 110</bibl></cit>: apud quosdam veteres auctores non invenio Lucretium consulem; <cit><quote lang="la">Bruto statim Horatium suggerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>place next in order</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:44" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quidam annales nihil praeter nomina consulum suggerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suggerebantur damna aleatoria,</quote> <trans><tr>were added</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suggestio: <entryFree id="n46482" type="main" key="suggesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suggestĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suggero</etym>. * <sense id="n46482.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an adding to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">addition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potus suggestione auctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13:182" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 13, 182</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46482.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n46482.2" n="A" level="2"> A rhet. fig., where the orator puts a question and answers it himself, <hi rend="ital">a suggestion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod schema quidam per suggestionem vocant, i. e. per subjectionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46482.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intimation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suggestion</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 9:20" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 9, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suggestum: <entryFree id="n46483" type="main" key="suggestum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suggestum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a raised place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex suggesto faleris prodeunt anates in stagnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46483.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a platform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tribune</hi> for a speaker: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in communibus suggestis consistere non auderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud suggestum, in quo causam dixerat, ascendens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:54:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 54, 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suggestus: <entryFree id="n46484" type="main" key="suggestus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suggestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from suggero.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46485" type="main" key="suggestus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suggestus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">suggestum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>suggero</etym>. <sense id="n46485.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to suggero, I.) An elevated place made of materials poured out; hence, <hi rend="ital">a raised place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevation</hi> (cf. pulpitum). </sense><sense id="n46485.1" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46485.2" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">labrum in suggestu inter dolia positum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapideus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 10, 21, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suggestus in orchestrā,</quote> <trans><tr>a raised seat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:91" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 91</bibl> Duk.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:51:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 51, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a lofty head-dress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:113" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46485.3" n="b" level="4"> In partic., a raised place to speak from to the people, to the troops, etc., <hi rend="ital">a platform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tribune</hi> (the class. signif. of the word): <cit><quote lang="la">suggestum in foro exstructum adornari placuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Maenius in suggestu rostra, devictis Antiatibus, fixerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 5, 11, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac re pro suggestu pronuntiatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in a milit. sense: de suggestu inquit, Auct. B. Afr. 54, 2: praemia pro suggestu tribuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 86, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suggestu, in quo Galbae statua fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non in modum contionis, aut suggestu locutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 55</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the prætor's tribunal: in excelso suggestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the emperor's seat: in curiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in orchestrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:51" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46485.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">height</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve se de tanto fortunarum suggestu pessum deiciat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 161, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46485.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A providing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preparation</hi> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Circensium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n46485.6" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to suggero, II.) <hi rend="ital">A hint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intimation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suggestion</hi> (syn. suggestio): <cit><quote lang="la">si ex suggestu eorum praeses dederit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:8:1:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 8, 1, § 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sugglutio: <entryFree id="n46486" type="hapax" key="sugglu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sug-glūtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>), <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hiccup a little</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suggrandis: <entryFree id="n46487" type="hapax" key="suggrandis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sug-grandis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather large</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suggredior: <entryFree id="n46488" type="main" key="suggre^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sug-grĕdĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>), <itype>gressus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n46488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [gradior], <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come up to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to approach</hi> (Tacitean). </sense><sense id="n46488.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesis qui barbarorum propius suggrediebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suggressi propius speculatores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">propius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 57</bibl></cit>; 14, 37.—</sense><sense id="n46488.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to attack</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos dux Romanus acie suggressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 4, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suggrunda: <entryFree id="n46489" type="main" key="suggrunda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sug-grunda</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. grando; Sanscr. hrāduni, storm; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xa/laza,</foreign> hail</etym>, <sense id="n46489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lower border of a roof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the eaves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:3:5:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 3, 5, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:242:section=1" default="NO">50, 16, 242, § 1</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">sug-grundium</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 160</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">suggrundātio</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suggrundarium: <entryFree id="n46490" type="hapax" key="suggrunda_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suggrundārĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>suggrunda</etym>, <sense id="n46490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the grave of a child less than forty days old</hi> (which was a niche in a wall, covered by a projecting roof or eaves; cf. columbarium, 2. d.): suggrundaria antiqui dicebant sepulcra infantium, qui necdum XL dies implessent, quia nec busta dici poterant, quia ossa quae comburerentur<cb n="SUI" />  non erant, nec tanta cadaveris immanitas, quā locus tumesceret. Unde Rutilius Geminus Astyanacte ait: <cit><quote lang="la">Melius suggrundarium misero quaereres quam sepulcrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Expos. Serm. Ant. p. 560</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suggrundatio: <entryFree id="n46491" type="main" key="suggrunda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suggrundātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">suggrundium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. suggrunda.</entryFree>
suggrunnio: <entryFree id="n46492" type="hapax" key="suggrunni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sug-grunnĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subgr-</orth>), <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grunt a little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 27, 345</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sugillatio: <entryFree id="n46493" type="main" key="su_gilla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūgillātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sugillo</etym>, <sense id="n46493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blackand-blue mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a livid spot</hi> (made by a blow, bruise, etc.; not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n46493.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sugillationem rapere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 24, § 74</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46493.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an affronting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insulting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foeda majestatis ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 45, 46, § 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsius gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admonitionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:22:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 22, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sugillatiuncula: <entryFree id="n46494" type="hapax" key="su_gilla_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūgillātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sugillatio</etym>, <sense id="n46494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small livid spot</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 2, 9</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
sugillatus: <entryFree id="n46495" type="hapax" key="su_gilla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūgillātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sugillo</etym>, post-class. for sugillatio, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 34</bibl>.</entryFree>
sugillo: <entryFree id="n46496" type="main" key="su_gillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūgillo</orth> (suggillo, oited ap. Victorin. p. 2465 P.), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. akin with sugo</etym>, <sense id="n46496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to beat black-andblue</hi> (mostly post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n46496.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi ex ictu suffusi cruore et sugillati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">athleta, qui numquam sugillatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 13, 2</bibl></cit>: oculos patri, perh. <hi rend="ital">to knock out</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 171, 13</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sūgillāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. loca), <hi rend="ital">black-and-blue spots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bruises</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">allium sugillata aut liventia ad colorem reducit,</quote> <trans><tr>black-and-blue spots</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus recens cum melle sugillata emendat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 34, § 132</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46496.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46496.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To flout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jeer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scoff at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viros sugillatos, repulsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:35:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 35, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sulla repulsa praeturae sugillatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:5:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitatem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3:4" default="NO">5, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli sugillare miserias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:10:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 4, 10, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:4:4:section=16" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 44, 4, 4, § 16</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">to annoy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 18, 5</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n46496.4" n="B" level="2"> = to beat into one, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to suggest</hi>: verba alicui, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 999.</sense></entryFree>
sugo: <entryFree id="n46497" type="main" key="su_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūgo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root svag-; cf. sucus</etym>, <sense id="n46497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to suck</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n46497.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(animalium) alia sugunt, alia carpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(agni) matris sugunt mammam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porca frequentiore numero sucta deficiet,</quote> <trans><tr>exhausted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <trans><tr>to exhaust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:44:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 44, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46497.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lacte nutricis errorem suxisse,</quote> <trans><tr>to have sucked</tr>, <tr>imbibed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sui: <entryFree id="n46498" type="main" key="su^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭi</orth> (<sense id="n46498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>), <case>dat.</case> sĭbī^, <case>acc.</case> and <case>abl.</case> sē or sēsē, <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number> (old <case>dat.</case> sĭbei, C. I. L. 1, 38; 1, 1056; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 1180 et saep.: sibe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 1267</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 300</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 24</bibl>; and v. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 180 sq.; on the quantity of the final i, v. Ritschl, Opusc. 2, p. 632 sqq.; old <case>acc.</case> sed, C. I. L. 1, 196, 13 sq.; 1, 197, 21; strengthened <case>acc.</case> sepse = se ipse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:8:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 8, 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:32" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 44, 8 al.</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> of 3d <hi rend="ital">pers.</hi> in recipr. and reflex. sense [Sanscr. sva-, svajam-, self; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(, ve, sfe</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">ou(=, oi(=, e(/</foreign>); cf. suus, old Lat. sovos; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 396" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 396</bibl>; Corss.
