Ausspr. 2, p. 54], <hi rend="ital">of himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of herself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of themselves; one another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">each other</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">her</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">them;</hi> and, as <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> of <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">they</hi> (on the use of se or sese in <case>acc.</case>, cf.: ut se dicamus, cum aliquem quid in alium fecisse ostendimus, ut puta: ille dicit se hoc illi fecisse; <cit><quote lang="la">cum autem in se ipsum, tunc dicamus sese, velut: dixit sese hoc sibi fecisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 1, 15, p. 86</bibl></cit> P.; but the distinction is not commonly observed; the two forms being used indifferently, except that sese is preferred where there is emphasis, especially at the beginning or end of a clause, or in reference to a preceding ipse; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; and cf. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 182 sqq.). </sense><sense id="n46498.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., as <hi rend="ital">pron. reflex.</hi>, of an object considered as receiving or affected by its own act, <hi rend="ital">himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">themselves.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46498.2" n="A" level="2"> In all clauses, referring to the grammatical subject of the clause. </sense><sense id="n46498.3" n="1" level="3"> As direct <hi rend="ital">obj.</hi> of <hi rend="ital">verb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedistine gladium, quī se occideret?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis eloquar quem ad modum se expediant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in plagas conicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam erit alienis gravis qui suis se concinnat levem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: se aperiunt,<cb n="SUI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adplicat ad Chrysidis patrem se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si is posset ab eā sese avellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi se ad nos adplicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per eos, ne causam diceret, se eripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ferrum se inflexisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipites fugae sese mandabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si se telo defenderet fur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catoni licuit Tusculi se in otio delectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum igitur quod se ipsum movet, numquam ne moveri quidem desinit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 25, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim homo se erexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores acceperamus se a Gallis auro redemisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:59:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 59, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in montem sese recipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad inpedimenta se conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese alicui ad pedes proicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se gerere,</quote> <trans><tr>to behave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 19, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic se res habet, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 271</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 10, 27</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod uxor sua ex fico se suspendisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 88</bibl></cit>. — Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">ipse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nom.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic se ipsus fallit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut se ipse diliget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse enim se quisque diligit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita non modo superiores, sed etiam se ipse correxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:52:176" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 52, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne animal se ipsum diligit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:9:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque prius vim adhibendam putaverunt, quam se ipse indicasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles se ipse interfecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne, ignorando regem, semet ipse aperiret quis esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sese ipsi gravant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 10</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inperator qui se ipsum non continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est enim se ipsum colligere, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:36:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 36, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 23, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quidam imperatores se ipsos dis inmortalibus devoverent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si se ipsos illi nostri liberatores e conspectu nostro abstulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admovisse semet ipsos lateri suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladio se ipsam transfixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:26:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 26, 3</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">gerund.</hi> construction: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sui in perpetuum liberandi occasionem dimittant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes sui conservandi causā profugerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximam causam ad se inundandam terra praestabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:29:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 29, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46498.4" n="2" level="3"> As indirect <hi rend="ital">obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo servit, non sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapiens ipsus fingit fortunam sibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ibi diffregisset crura aut cervices sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil aliud nisi quod sibi soli placet consulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerunt sibi liberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum habeat sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum multae sibi expetessunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum me convivam solum abducebat sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sibi soli postulat, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc sibi uxorem expetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is sibi legationem ad civitates suscepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque sibi homines feros temperaturos existimabat, quin exirent, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sibi nomen adrogare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:33:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 33, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia sunt tamquam sibi nata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proposita sibi morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 21, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne, illo cunctante, Numidae sibi consulant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 62, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut populum Romanum sibi desumerent hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Turnus, praelatum sibi advenam aegre patiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petebant ut regis sui filiam matrimonio sibi jungeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo sibi tantummodo errat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum sibi ad formam sui exsculpsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ipse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse tantos sibi spiritus sumpserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ipsi sibi exemplo sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste, quasi praedā sibi advectā, ducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:25:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 25, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Junius necem sibi ipse conscivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntarium non sibimet ipse solum, sed etiam funeri suo exilium indixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:52:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 52, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde consulant sibi ipsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:4:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia, quae quicquid omnibus abstulit, sibi ipsi neget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1, prol. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, prol. 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Marc. 5, 13</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46498.5" n="3" level="3"> After <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino est amans sui virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sit sui similis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem naturam esse servatricem sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:9:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum videret, si non paruisset, dissimilem se futurum sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 43</bibl>: nihil malo quam et me mei similem esse et illos sui, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 16</bibl>, A, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">habetis ducem memorem vestri, oblitum sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potens sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est tam incontinens sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:30:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 30, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sibi obsit, quia sit sibi inimicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:10:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: inimicus ipse <pb n="1795" /> <cb n="SUI" /> sibi putandus est, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipsi homines sibi sint per se cari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Medus infestus sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crescit indulgens sibi hydrops,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim utilius quicquam est quam sibi utilem fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:11:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Campanus se digna probra in insontem jacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mundus) se ipse consumptione alebat sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multa adsoleat veritas praebere vestigia sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:54:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 54, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecus amor sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui contemptor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in spem sui bonam adducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:21:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aër) imā sui parte maxime varius est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:11:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa (virtus) pretium sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 9:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque est quod existimes illum vilem sibi fuisse: pretium se sui fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:9:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe taedio laboris ad vilitatem sui compelluntur ignavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo non benignus est sui judex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:26:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanus in ipso fine vitae vindex sui exstitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equestris ordinis juventus omnibus annis bis urbem spectaculo sui celebrabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">ipse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utpote ipsā sui appellatione virorum majestati debitum a feminis reddens honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46498.6" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui admisit in se culpam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam ut ab se segregent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segregat ab se omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ad se deduxit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 121</bibl></cit>; 3, 1, 118; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae me non excludit ab se, sed apud se occludet domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet aliud (negotium) magis ex se et majus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et fingunt quandam inter se nunc fallaciam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duxit secum virginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:18" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex se generare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: — pro se quisque = unusquisque, <hi rend="ital">every one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">each one singly</hi>, etc., freq. in Livy (cf. suus, II. D. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">Pro se quisque id quod quisque potest ... Edit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro se quisque alius agnum inmolabat, alius pullum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro se quisque sedulo Faciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pro se quisque tenderet ad portas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 9</bibl>; 1, 59; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 6: — Boiosque receptos ad se socios sibi adsciscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum ante se mittit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra se collocare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex materiā in se omnia recipiente mundum factum esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras ad se ab amico missas protulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam prae se agentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:21" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (rem publicam) exercitus, quantum in se fuit, prodebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphic. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphic. 3, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 12, 2</bibl> (v. infra, II. B. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus poterat sauciis ductis secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 39</bibl></cit>.—Rarely referring to <hi rend="ital">subj. inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam dicere apud eum de facinore ... cum per se ipsum consideres, grave est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quia per se beatum est malo caruisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1, prol. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, prol. 6</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46498.7" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> in <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis se aut suorum aliquem praetermissum queratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (nominibus) illae res publicae sese appellari velint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se minus timidos existimari volebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46498.8" n="6" level="3"> As predicate ( = suus, II. B. 2. <foreign lang="greek">d;</foreign> very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quisquis est deus, si modo est alius ... totus est sensuus, totus visuus, totus audituus, totus animae, totus animi, totus sui,</quote> <trans><tr>in his own power</tr>, <tr>independent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 14</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46498.9" n="B" level="2"> Referring to a <hi rend="ital">logical subject</hi>, other than the grammatical subj. of the clause. </sense><sense id="n46498.10" n="1" level="3"> To a <hi rend="ital">definite subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque praeter se umquam ei servos fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc aiebant indignum civitate ac sese vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 176</bibl></cit>: exercitum consumptum videtis; <cit><quote lang="la">quem turpiter se ex fugā recipientem ne qua civitas recipiat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquos sese convertere cogunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis illi in urbibus reficiendi se et curandi potestas fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur his persequendi juris sui adimis potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum nihil sit periculosius quam spatium confirmandi sese Antonio dari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam ingenuit animantibus conservandi sui natura custodiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque sui colligendi hostibus facultatem relinquunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quam minimum spatii ad se colligendos Romanis daretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19</bibl></cit>; 3, 4; 4, 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:16" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallica acies nullum spatium respirandi recipiendique se dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 28, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec raptis aut spes de se melior aut indignatio est minor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: Faustulo spes fuerat regiam stirpem<cb n="SUI" />  apud se educari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium cum fiduciā sui commissum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 33, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 14, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">detecta fraus cautiores Thyreensis fecit: dato responso, nullam se novam societatem accepturos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres censuerunt, qui honorem, quem sibi capere per leges liceret, peteret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jusso magistro equitum abdicare se magistratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:33:12" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 33, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum apud timentes sibimet ipsos increpuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ipso, quaerenti sibi commendationem ad gentem monitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 8, 4</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">signa peditum, prae se habentium scuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invenere oppidanos vim hostium ab se arcentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exire enim sua secum efferentibus jussis primum arma ademit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 18, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">§ 10: quos in numerum pecorum redegit ignoratio sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 5:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia nullum illis sui regimen est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 94, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se nihil inlicitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi objurgatio sui est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46498.11" n="2" level="3"> To <hi rend="ital">indefinite subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deforme est de se ipsum praedicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:38:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 38, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posse enim liberalitate uti non spoliantem se patrimonio nimirum est pecuniae fructus maximus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non arbitrari sese scire quod nesciat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui proposita sit conservatio sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:13:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic amicitiae ... effectrices sunt voluptatum tam amicis quam sibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare ... etiam si ad se ex iis nihil redeat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(judicatio) quae aut sui laudem aut adversarii vituperationem contineat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:51:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 51, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39, 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quanti quisque se faciat, tanti fiat ab amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 28, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:17:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 17, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nullus ex se metus aut spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterum et interrogandi se ipsum et respondendi sibi solent esse non ingratae vices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi servire gravissima est servitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3</bibl></cit>, praef. 17: <cit><quote lang="la">quam multa sunt vota, quae etiam sibi fateri pudet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:38:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 6, 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec haec vilitas sui est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clem. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpa est, immiscere se rei ad se non pertinenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:17:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 17, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profecto est supplicio se liberare tam facile quam supplicium perpeti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n46498.12" n="II" level="1"> Hence, in dependent clauses, transf., as <hi rend="ital">pers. pron.</hi> 3d <hi rend="ital">pers.</hi>, with reflex. reference, <hi rend="ital">him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">her</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">them; he</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she</hi>, <hi rend="ital">they</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n46498.13" n="A" level="2"> In gen., of an obj. indentified with, </sense><sense id="n46498.14" n="1" level="3"> The <hi rend="ital">gram. subj.</hi> of the principal clause: <cit><quote lang="la">qui omnis se amare credit, quemque aspexerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa mulier lapidem silicem subigere ut se amet, potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orare jussit, si se ames, jam ut ad sese venias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ait, si ... non id metuat, ne, ubi acceperim, Sese relinquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timet animum amicae se erga ut sit suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque jussit interfici, alterum, quia viam demonstravisset interimendi sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui precabantur, ut sibi sui liberi superstites essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 28, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 17, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ipse quidem suā tantā eloquentiā mihi persuasisset, ut se dimitterem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 28, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetrat a senatu, ut dies sibi prorogaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:38:section=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 38, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc sibi ex animo scrupulum, qui se dies noctisque stimulat, ut evellatis, postulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iccius nuntios ad eum mittit, nisi subsidium sibi submittatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos cum apud se conspexisset ... quid ad se venirent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittit, qui petant atque orent, ut sibi subveniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipionem Hannibal eo ipso, quod adversus se dux lectus esset, praestantem virum credebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 39, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pausanias orare coepit, ne se prodiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ejus principes animadvertisset timere, ne propter se bellum eis Lacedaemonii indicerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Them. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ubii legatos mittunt, qui doceant ... neque ab se fidem laesam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum Volero, ubi indignantium pro se acerrimus erat clamor, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:55:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 55, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transfugit, patris in se saevitiam conquerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 53, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia imposuit in urbibus, quae ad se defecerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 61, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigia sarcina depressa parum ostendunt non aquam sibi resistere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:9:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—So in phrases incorporated with a principal clause: <cit><quote lang="la">Nicias vehementer tuā sui memoriā delectatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est appetentius similium sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: Pompeius facultatem sui insequendi ademerat, Caes. B. <cb n="SUI" /> C. 1, 29: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectum in se ruentem trans fixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rediere cum legatis ad redimendos sese missis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:59:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 59, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestatem omnibus adeundi sui fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germanicus legiones universas sibi summam reipublicae deferentes compescuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam si di inmortales potestatem visendi sui faciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:19:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(terra) non potest tam multa tantoque se ipsā majora nutrire, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:16:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 6, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46498.15" n="2" level="3"> Of an obj. indentified with a logical subj., other than the gram. subj. of the leading clause: <cit><quote lang="la">a Caesare valde liberaliter invitor, sibi ut sim legatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum unum quidque ... a se potius quam ab adversariis stare demonstrabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:43:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 43, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 16, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam mihi scito jam a regibus adlatas esse litteras, quibus mihi gratias agant, quod se meā sententiā reges appellaverim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testem rei publicae relinquere, meae perpetuae erga se voluntatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos non tam ulcisci studeo quam sanare sibi ipsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ex oppido cum legati ad eum venissent oratum, ut sibi ignosceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ei in suspitionem venisset, aliquid in epistulā de se esse scriptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortem octavam decimam Lugduni, solitis sibi hibernis, relinqui placuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 64</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46498.16" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in reported words or thoughts (orat. obliqua) referring to the person to whom they are ascribed. </sense><sense id="n46498.17" n="1" level="3"> As <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obj.</hi>, direct or indirect, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos Hannibal misit astrictos jure jurando se redituros esse, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Postumius mihi nuntiavit ... se a Marcello ad me missum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui dixisse fertur a se visum esse Romulum ... eum sibi mandasse ut populum rogaret ut sibi eo in colle delubrum fieret: se deum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 35, 95</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntium mittit ... sese diutius sustinere non posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Divitiacus Caesarem obsecrare coepit ... scire se illa esse vera, nec quemquam ex eo plus quam se doloris capere ... sese tamen amore fraterno commoveri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum se esse, qui, etc. ... ob eam rem se ex civitate profugisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sibi esse curae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sese Gallis, sed Gallos sibi bellum intulisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsos se inter multitudinem militum occultasse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensit Themistocles, si eo pervenisset, sibi esse pereundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dato responso (sc. a Thyreensibus), nullam se novam societatem accepturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 12, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46498.18" n="2" level="3"> In subordinate clauses, questions, exhortations, etc., with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46498.19" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui abs te taciti requirunt, cur sibi hoc oneris imposueris, cur se potissimum delegeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:18:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 18, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Marc. 10, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclamavit, quid ad se venirent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum petere ac deprecari ... ne se armis despoliaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quos cum Caesar nuntios misisset, qui postularent, eos qui sibi bellum intulissent, sibi dederent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur sui quicquam esse imperii trans Rhenum postularet?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicero respondit, si ab armis discedere velint, se adjutore utantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneti legationem ad Crassum mittunt, si velit suos recipere, obsides sibi remittat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex ignarus quae legati ejus (Hannibalis) ad se adlaturi fuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac necessitate coactus, domino navis, qui sit, aperit, multa pollicens, si se conservasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatos in Bithyniam miserunt, qui ab rege peterent, ne inimicissimum suum secum haberent sibique dederet (for secum, v. I. A. 4. supra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46498.20" n="b" level="4"> Esp., in subordinate clauses (sub-oblique), with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> expressing the assertion or view of the person reported as speaking: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam Caesarem injuriam facere, qui vectigalia sibi deteriora faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sibi Caesar denuntiaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed eo deceptum, quod neque commissum a se intellegeret, quāre timeret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nec paratus ... obsecutus esset, credidissetque, cum se vidissent Aetoli, omnia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 44, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ambiorix locutus est, ... sua esse ejusmodi imperia, ut non minus haberet juris in se multitudo, quam ipse in multitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Divitiacus ait, ... nec quemquam ex eo plus quam se doloris capere, propterea quod per se crevisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: eos incusavit, quod sibi <pb n="1796" /> <cb n="SUI" /> quaerendum aut cogitandum putarent, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decima legio Caesari gratias egit, quod de se optimum judicium fecisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doluisse se, quod populi Romani beneficium sibi extorqueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ei dormienti eundem visum esse rogare ut, quoniam sibi vivo non subvenisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 27, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipionem Hannibal eo ipso, quod adversus se dux potissimum lectus esset, praestantem virum credebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 39, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pausanias orare coepit ... quod si eam veniam sibi dedisset, magno ei praemio futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque prius vim adhibendam putaverunt, quam se ipse indicasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar legatos cum his mandatis mittit, Quoniam ... hanc sibi populoque Romano gratiam referret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos esse iniquos, quod in suo jure se interpellaremus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ipsos in his contentionibus, quas Aedui secum habuissent, usos esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximae sibi laetitiae esse praedicavit, quod aliquos patria sua se meliores viros haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>, ext. 5.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> when the author asserts the action as a fact: Volero, ubi indignantium pro se acerrimus erat clamor, etc. ( = eo; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">infra, C.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:55:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 55, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46498.21" n="C" level="2"> Without reflex. reference, = an oblique case of is or ipse (in the best prose rare, and mostly where the conception of the orat. obliq. is suggested by the context; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">B. 2. b. supra): i, seis, jube transire huc quantum possit, se ut videant domi Familiares ( = eam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me misit miles ad Eam ... ut hinc in Elatiam hodie eat secum semul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eum, qui se hic vidit, verbis vincat, ne is se viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. v. 35; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 2, 54: ut eam in se dignam condicicnem conlocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi hi mihi dant viam, quo pacto ab se argentum auferam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicit capram, quam dederam servandam sibi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum hoc scio, esse meritam, ut memor esses sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Epaminondas accusatur, quod ei, qui sibi ex lege praetor successerat, exercitum non tradiderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:33:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 33, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et se ipsum nobis, et eos, qui ante se fuerunt, in medio posuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit> (but B. and K. bracket se): <cit><quote lang="la">Dexo hic, quem videtis, non quae privatim sibi eripuisti, sed unicum abs te filium flagitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:49:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 49, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea quam exposuit quae sibi videbantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:54:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 54, 122</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">B. and K. ipsi): et cum ad illum scribas, nihil te recordari de se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:7:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 7, § 23</bibl></cit> (B. and K. bracket de se): <cit><quote lang="la">quem Caesar, ut erat de se meritus, donatum pronuntiavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar Rhenum transire constituit ... quod auxilia contra se Treveris miserant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 9 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Metellus ... in eis urbibus, quae ad se defecerant ... praesidia inponit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 61, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:66:1" default="NO" valid="yes">66, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bocchus flectitur, reputando quae sibi duobus proeliis venerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 103:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 103, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuit urbis, quae ... adversum se opportunissimae erant, circumvenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 88:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 88, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse ... ex perfugis cognitis ... qui cum eo (Scipione) bellum contra se gerebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 8" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel quia nil rectum, nisi quod placuit sibi, ducunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum boves militibus dono dedit, qui secum fuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 37, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem angebat, quod Capua pertinacius oppugnata ab Romanis quam defensa ab se ... animos averterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter victus fratrum ante se strage,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 25, 11</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 6, 12: Caesar ... omnibus qui contra se arma tulerant, ignovit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:56:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 56, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam obsidione Massiliae, quae sibi in itinere portas clauserat, retardante ... tamen omnia subegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus rector circa se dimicans occubuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eos coëgit superare Lacedaemonios, quos ante se nemo ausus fuit aspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 8, 3</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ante illum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphic. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Iphic. 1, 3</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">quae nox sibi proxima venit, insomnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 805</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n46498.22" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pron. recipr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">each other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam cum esset Praenestinis nuntiatum ... patres ac plebem in semet ipsos versos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 28, 1</bibl></cit>; so very rare, except in phrase: inter se, <hi rend="ital">one another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">each other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reciprocally,</hi> = <foreign lang="greek">a)llh/lous</foreign> (prop. <hi rend="ital">between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among them</hi>, <hi rend="ital">among themselves</hi>, hence no ellips. of another se is to be assumed; cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 609; Hand, Turs. 3, p. 397 sqq.): nil cessarunt ilico Osculari atque<cb n="SUI" />  amplexari inter se, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">video eos inter se amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque solum colent inter se ac diligent (cf. ante: alter ab altero postulabit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 22, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicerones pueri amant inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 44, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se adspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se congruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complecti inter se milites coepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 42, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut neque inter se contingant trabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se nondum satis noti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 39, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus et senatus Romanus placide modesteque inter se rempublicam tractabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum summā inter se contentione gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum inter se timerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 4, 2</bibl>: haec inter se quam repugnent, <hi rend="ital">contradict</hi> one another, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:29:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 29, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:12:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 12, 30</bibl> (cf.: sibi repugnare, <hi rend="ital">to be inconsistent</hi> with itself; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 1018): inter se differre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur legendi sint, nisi ipsi inter se, qui idem sentiunt, non intellego,</quote> <trans><tr>by one another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam inter se similis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res inter se similes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:17" default="NO">9, 4, 17</bibl>. — With <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhaesitationes atomorum inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res eos in bello inter se habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">auxerant inter se opinionem,</quote> <trans><tr>their mutual regard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 39, 9</bibl></cit>.—Pleon.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam inter se utriusque conferte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositis inter se rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitatur duriorum inter se congressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 35</bibl></cit>.—Of local relation: <cit><quote lang="la">duas insulas propinquas inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 61</bibl></cit> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 98:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 98, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam haud procul inter se erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 53:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 53, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud longe inter se castra facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 55:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 55, 6</bibl></cit> (inter se, without recipr. reference, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, I. A. 4.).</sense><sense id="n46498.23" n="IV" level="1"> Idiomatic uses. </sense><sense id="n46498.24" n="A" level="2"> Se, with <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">home;</hi> mostly ad se, apud se, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">home</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at home</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae me non excludet ab se, sed apud se occludet domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam in aedis me ad se deduxit domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ad se ad prandium, ad cenam vocant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 118</bibl></cit>: intro nos vocat ad sese, tenet intus apud se, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 86</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Caesar, ut veniam ad se, rogat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui a me petierit ut secum et apud se essem cottidie,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46498.25" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">num tibi videtur esse apud sese?</quote> <trans><tr>in his senses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 85</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46498.26" n="B" level="2"> Sibi pleonast. as <case>dat.</case> of the interested person: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse autem Ariovistus tantus sibi spiritus sumpserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum sibi M. Pisonis domum ubi habitaret elegerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. I. A. 2. supra. So esp. freq. in expressions of surprise or abrupt questions (commonly, but loosely called a <hi rend="ital">dat. ethic.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quid sibi vult pater? cur simulat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sibi hic vestitus quaerit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes admiratio cepit, quidnam sibi repentinus clamor vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ergo sibi vult pars altera orationis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirantes, quid sibi vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 35, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:15" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 50, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 13, 12</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">32, 25, 10: pro deum fidem quid vobis vultis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 67, 7</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46498.27" n="C" level="2"> Sibi with <hi rend="ital">suus</hi>, emphasizing the idea of possession, <hi rend="ital">his own</hi>, etc. (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cocleae ... Suo sibi suco vivont,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed is quo pacto serviat suo sibi patri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> prol. 5; <cit><quote lang="la">46: si ille huc salvos revenit, reddam suom sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 119</bibl></cit> Brix. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">suam sibi rem salvam sistam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus argumento'st suom sibi proscaenium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> prol. 57; <cit><quote lang="la">97: omnem rem inveni, ut sua sibi pecunia hodie illam faciat leno libertam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo sibi gnato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc telo suo sibi a foribus pellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua sibi ingenua indoles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo sibi gladio hunc jugulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas suo sibi pampino tegito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo sibi jure ablui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:R. R. 12:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 12, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:41" default="NO">12, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo sibi argumento refutatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo sibi lacte aleret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a suis sibi parentibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 104, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suis sibi domibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>, p. 106, 31; 4, p. 157, 7; <cit><quote lang="la">6, p. 186, 24: qui Deo ... sua sibi opera praetulerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 28, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suo sibi pervoluta sanguine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 207, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sua sibi natione captivus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">IN SVO SIBI POSITVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">AEDEM CVM SVO SIBI HYPOGAEO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Rein.</author> p. 646, 109</bibl></cit>.—In many passages in class. prose sibi <cb n="SULC" /> occurs with suus, but retains its pronom. force: <cit><quote lang="la">factus consul est bis, primum ante tempus, iterum sibi suo tempore, rei publicae paene sero,</quote> <trans><tr>in good time for himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis superque esse sibi suarum cuique rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam tu suum sibi venderes, ipse possedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vult ille inbecillitatis sibi suae conscius timere pituitam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:2:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit> (v. suus II. D. 3. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
suifico: <entryFree id="n46499" type="main" key="su^i^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make his own</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Rustic. c. Aceph. p. 1245.</sense></entryFree>
suile: <entryFree id="n46500" type="main" key="su^i_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭīle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sus</etym>, <sense id="n46500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hog-sty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suillates: <entryFree id="n46501" type="main" key="Su^illa_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭillātes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Umbria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suillus: <entryFree id="n46502" type="main" key="su^illus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭillus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sus</etym>, <sense id="n46502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to swine.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46502.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 52, 78, § 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 33, 51, § 121</bibl></cit>: caro, <hi rend="ital">swine</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s flesh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pork</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 29, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fungi, an inferior kind of mushroom,</quote> <trans><tr>black hogmushrooms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 23, 47, § 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:60:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 60, 5</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46502.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. caro), <hi rend="ital">pork</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:30" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 5, 12, § 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suinus: <entryFree id="n46503" type="main" key="su^i_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to swine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swine-</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 594</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit> (MSS.; <cit><quote lang="la">Gesn. and Schneid. suilla): sevum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suiones: <entryFree id="n46504" type="main" key="Sui^o^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suĭŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a northern Germanic people of Scandinavia</hi>, in the mod. <hi rend="ital">Sweden</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 44</bibl> and 45.</sense></entryFree>
suismontium: <entryFree id="n46505" type="main" key="Suismontium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suismontium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n46505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain of Liguria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:41" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sulca: <entryFree id="n46506" type="main" key="Sulca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sulca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Baetius Sulca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sulcamen: <entryFree id="n46507" type="hapax" key="sulca_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sulcāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sulco</etym>, <sense id="n46507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a furrow</hi>, = sulcus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 174, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sulcator: <entryFree id="n46508" type="main" key="sulca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sulcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who draws furrows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a furrower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plougher</hi> (in postAug. poets). </sense><sense id="n46508.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Leontini campi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv.
