default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: est vero, inquit, Africane, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est ut dicis, inquam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit quidem ut sex milia seminum intereant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esto: ipse nihil est, nihil potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verum esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:23:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 23, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 313</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 81</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 37 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n46529.27" n="b" level="4"> The connections est ut, ubi, cum, quod, or with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it happens</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chances that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is the case that, there is cause</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reason why</hi>, <hi rend="ital">there is a time when</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is allowed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">permissible that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one may</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n46529.28" n="(a)" level="5"> Est ut, <hi rend="ital">it is the case</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sin est, ut velis Manere illam apud te, dos hic maneat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7</bibl></cit> (8), 32: <cit><quote lang="la">si est, ut dicat velle se, Redde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si est, culpam ut Antipho in se admiserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est, ut id maxime deceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:59:199" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 59, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando fuit, ut, quod licet, non liceret?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 20, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est igitur, ut mirandum sit, ea praesentiri, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div 1, 56, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non erat, ut fieri posset, mirarier umquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:979" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 979</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futurum esse ut omnes pellerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est, ut copia major Ab Jove donari possit tibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est ut viro vir latius ordinet Arbusta sulcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:7:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 7, 2</bibl>.—Cf. esse after a neg., with <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam est enim, quin aliquid memoriae tradere velimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 24, 40</bibl></cit>.—Also, est ut, <hi rend="ital">there is reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">magis est ut ipse moleste ferat errasse se, quam ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 6, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: ille erat ut odisset primum defensorem salutis meae, <hi rend="ital">he had good reason for hating</hi> <pb n="1799" /> <cb n="SUM" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 13, 35</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid erat cur Milo optaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque est ut putemus ignorari ea ab animalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46529.29" n="(b)" level="5"> Est ubi, <hi rend="ital">sometime</hi> or <hi rend="ital">another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sometimes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erit, ubi te ulciscar, si vivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est, ubi id isto modo valeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:8:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 8, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46529.30" n="(g)" level="5"> Est cum, <hi rend="ital">sometimes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est cum non est satius, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 26, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46529.31" n="(d)" level="5"> Est quod, <hi rend="ital">there is reason to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I have occasion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est quod visam domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi magis est, quod gratuler tibi quam quod te rogem,</quote> <trans><tr>I have more reason to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est quod referam ad consilium: sin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 31, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod timeas non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil est illic quod moremur diutius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est quod multa loquamur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>.—Cf. with <hi rend="ital">cur</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est cur eorum spes infragatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est cur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 20, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Est, sit, etc., with <hi rend="ital">infin.</hi> in Gr. constr., <hi rend="ital">it is possible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is allowed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permitted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one may</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">est quādam prodire tenus, si non datur ultra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato, R. R. prooem. § 1: scire est liberum Ingenium atque animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec non et Tityon terrae omniparentis alumnum Cernere erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 596</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 676</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:413" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 413</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque est te fallere quicquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 447</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde Plus haurire est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est Gaudia prodentem vultum celare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod versu dicere non est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tangere non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae verbo objecta, verbo negare sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 41, 2</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut conjectare erat intentione vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est videre argentea vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 8</bibl>; v. Zumpt, Gram. § 227.— With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tibi sit frigida saxa adire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:24" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 24</bibl> (32): <cit><quote lang="la">tu procul a patriā (nec sit mihi credere tantum!) Alpinas nives Me sine vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuerit mihi eguisse aliquando amicitiae tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 110:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 110, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:72:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 72, § 4</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) In eo ease ut, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be in a condition to reach the point that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be possible</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be about to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the point of</hi>, etc. (<hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> or with res, etc., as <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam in eo esset, ut in muros evaderet miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si viderent in eo jam esse ut urbs caperetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 22, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque in eo rem fore, ut Romani aut hostes aut domini habendi sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum res non in eo essent ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 41, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non in eo esse Carthaginiensium res, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:41" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 41</bibl>. —With <hi rend="ital">person. subj.</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum ab Ulixe adducta Iphigenia in eo esset, ut immolaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 261" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 261</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46529.32" n="6" level="3"> Like the Engl. <hi rend="ital">to be</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">to come</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have arrived</hi>, etc. (hence also with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>): <cit><quote lang="la">ecquid in mentem est tibi, Patrem tibi esse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam numero mi in mentem fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eo tempore res esse in vadimonium coepit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus in praedonum fuisse potestatem sciatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut certior fieret, quo die in Tusculanum essem futurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui neque in provinciam cum imperio fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ne in potestatem quidem populi Romani esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec prius militibus in conspectum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in amicitiam populi Romani dicionemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:20:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 20, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in eorum potestatem portum futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:38:section=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 38, § 98</bibl></cit>; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:16 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 16 sq.</bibl>; Zumpt, Gram. § 316.—</sense><sense id="n46529.33" n="7" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elapse</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">diem scito nullum esse, quo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n46529.34" n="II" level="1"> As a copula, <hi rend="ital">to be</hi> any thing or in any manner. </sense><sense id="n46529.35" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n46529.36" n="1" level="3"> With an <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et praeclara res est et sumus otiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in homine multo est evidentius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperare videor Scipionis et Laelii amicitiam notam posteritati fore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sum ita hebes, ut istud dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum, ignorante rege, uter esset Orestes, Pylades Orestem se esse diceret, Orestes autem ita ut erat, Orestem se esse perseveraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul autem esse qui potui? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos numerus sumus et fruges consumere nati,</quote> <trans><tr>are a mere number</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars non minima triumphi est victimae praecedentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobile erit Romae pascua vestra forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 20: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis erant lacrimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:811" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 811</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego tu sum, tu es ego: unanimi sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuos sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: domus <cb n="SUM" /> non ea est, quam parietes nostri cingunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 13, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is enim fueram, cui, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46529.37" n="2" level="3"> Less freq. with <pos>adv.</pos> (esp. in colloq. language): <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Satin' tu sanus es? <hi rend="ital">Sos.</hi> Sic sum ut vides, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic, inquit, est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est, inquit, ut dicis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ita cum sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 45, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia sunt haud procul ab hujus aetatis memoriā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero habere virtutem satis est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: frustra id inceptum Volscis fuit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dato qui bene sit: ego, ubi bene sit, tibi locum lepidum dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud matrem recte est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in convivio comiter et jucunde fuisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes hanc quaestionem haud remissius sperant futuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta impune erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 72</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: facile alicubi (in aliquā re) esse, <hi rend="ital">with pleasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glad to be</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in maritimis facillime sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum habeo nullum ubi facilius esse possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 26, 2</bibl></cit> (on esse with an adverb, v. Haase ap. Reisig, Vorles. p. 394; cf. also bene under bonus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n46529.38" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46529.39" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. part.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belong to</hi> a class, party, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in republicā ita est versatus, ut semper optimarum partium et esset et existimaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ejusdem civitatis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Them. 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Romanae partis erant, urbe excesserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:51:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 51, 7</bibl></cit>: ut aut amicorum aut inimicorum Campani simus; <cit><quote lang="la">si defenditis, vestri, si deseritis, Samnitium erimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:9 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 30, 9 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n46529.40" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <case>abl.</case> denoting quality. </sense><sense id="n46529.41" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium me timidum, nullius animi, nullius consilii fuisse confiteor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputatio non mediocris contentionis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni judicii, summae etiam facultatis esse debebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:21:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 21, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(virtus) nec tantarum virium est, ut se ipsa tueatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sulla gentis patriciae nobilis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 95:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 95, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summi ut sint laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas magnae auctoritatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refer, Cujus fortunae (sit),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se nullius momenti apud exercitum futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ejusdem aetatis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invicti ad laborem corporis erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec magni certaminis ea dimicatio fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somni brevissimi erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 33</bibl></cit>.—So of extent, number, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">classis centum navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus trecentarum sexaginta quinque dierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46529.42" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">bono animo es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam aetate eā sum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum variā victoriā fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Catilina nobili genere natus fuit magna vi et animi et corporis, set ingenio malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sulla animo ingenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 95:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 95, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse magnā gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuissimā valetudine esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fuerit is injustus, timidus, hebeti ingenio atque nullo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:15:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 15, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirā sum alacritate ad litigandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bono animo sint et tui et mei familiares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut bono essent animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut uxores eodem jure sint quo viri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui capite et superciliis semper est rasis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi, quaere, unde domo quis, Cujus fortunae, quo sit patre quove patrono,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 54</bibl></cit> (cf. I. A. 4. supra). —</sense><sense id="n46529.43" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abl. of price</hi> or <hi rend="ital">value.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46529.44" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluris est oculatus testis quam auriti decem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtur esse quantivis pretii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a me argentum, quanti (servus) est, sumito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ullo in loco frumentum tanti fuit, quanti iste aestimavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:84:section=194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 84, § 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager nunc multo pluris est, quam tunc fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque, quod plurimi sit, possideat, ita, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:2:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni erunt mihi tuae litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvi sunt foris arma, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 22, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an emat denario quod sit mille denariūm,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 23, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvi pretii est quod nihili est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea mihi conscientia pluris est quam omnium sermo,</quote> <trans><tr>is worth more to me</tr>, <tr>weighs more with me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque pluris pretii cocum quam vilicum habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat (agellus) centum milium nummūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46529.45" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: sextante sal et Romae et per totam I<hi rend="ital">i</hi>aliam erat, <hi rend="ital">was worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stood at</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46529.46" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. of possession</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">it belongs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pertains to;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it is the part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">property</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">custom</hi>, or <cb n="SUM" /> <hi rend="ital">duty of</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n46529.47" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">audiant eos, quorum summa est auctoritas apud, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>who possess</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea ut civitatis Rhodiorum essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:55:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 55, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneamus eum cursum, qui semper fuit optimi cujusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamobrem neque sapientis esse accipere habenas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:20:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 20, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientis est consilium explicare suum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 81, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritas est florentis aetatis, prudentia senescentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est adulescentis majores natu vereri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aemilius, cujus tum fasces erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota tribuniciae potestatis erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterius morientis prope totus exercitus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam me Pompeii totum esse scis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum, non causarum, toti erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs novarum, ut solet, rerum atque Hannibalis tota esse,</quote> <trans><tr>were devoted to</tr>, <tr>favored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dolopes numquam Aetolorum fuerant: Philippi erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ptolemaeus propter aetatem alieni arbitrii erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est miserorum ut malevolentes sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod alterum divinitatis mihi cujusdam videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:20:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 20, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negavit moris esse Graecorum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est gravitatis ac sapientiae tuae, ferre immoderatius casum incommodorum tuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est hoc Gallicae consuetudinis, uti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">pronom. posses.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est tuum, Cato, videre quid agatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:38:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 38, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit meum quidem jam pridem rem publicam lugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 28, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46529.48" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp., with <hi rend="ital">gerundive</hi>, to denote tendency, effect, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res evertendae rei publicae solerent esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regium inperium, quod initio conservandae libertatis fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui utilia ferrent, quaeque aequandae libertatis essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea prodendi imperii Romani, tradendae Hannibali victoriae esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam aequandae libertatis esse quam potentissimum quemque posse dicere causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:51:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 51, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustrationem eam legis tollendae esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 24, 1</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; 3, 39, 8; 5, 3, 5; 40, 29, 11.—</sense><sense id="n46529.49" n="5" level="3"> With <case>dat.</case> of the end, object, purpose, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam hanc rusticam tu probro et crimini putas esse oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 17, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam quae esui potuique non sunt, contineri legato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:9:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut divites conferrent, qui essent oneri ferendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis vis morbi curae esset, maxime quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum solvendo aere (i. e. aeri) alieno res publica non esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniciuntur ea, quae umori extrahendo sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— Esp. in phrase solvendo esse, <hi rend="ital">to be solvent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">able to pay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu nec solvendo eras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum solvendo civitates non essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit> (v. solvo).—</sense><sense id="n46529.50" n="6" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">predicative dat. sing.</hi>, denoting that which the subject is, becomes, appears to be, etc. </sense><sense id="n46529.51" n="(a)" level="5"> Without second <hi rend="ital">dat. of pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilio is fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis curae'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:13 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 13 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui bono fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo natus sum ut Jugurthae scelerum ostentui essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 24, 10</bibl></cit>: cupis me esse nequam; <cit><quote lang="la">tamen ero frugi bonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnoque esse argumento, homines scire pleraque antequam nati sint, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:21:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 21, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi Indicioque sui facti persaepe fuere, Lucr 4, 1019: ejus rei ipsa verba formulae testimonio sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec res ad levandam annonam impedimento fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus rei Demosthenes atque Aeschines possunt esse documento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46529.52" n="(b)" level="5"> With second <hi rend="ital">dat. of pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsecro vos ego mi auxilio sitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid Captioni mihi sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi cordi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi eris damno molestiae et dedecori saepe fueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metuo illaec mihi res ne malo magno fuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Salus nobis saluti jam esse potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bono usui estis nulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sint nobis morbo mortique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1095" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1095</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo magis quae agis curae sunt mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omitto innumerabiles viros, quorum singuli saluti huic civitati fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: ut mihi magnae curae tuam vitam ac dignitatem esse scires, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8</bibl>, A <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusant ei, quibus occidi patrem Sex. Roscii bono fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: haec tam parva <pb n="1800" /> <cb n="SUMM" /> civitas praedae tibi et quaestui fuit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:37:section=85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 37, § 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea dictitare, quae detrimento, maculae, invidiae, infamiae nobis omnibus esse possint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 62</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">144: minus ea bella curae patribus erant, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sciant patribus aeque curae fuisse, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc perinde curae est tibi quam illud mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantaeque curae tibi fuit, ne quis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:25:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantae sit mihi curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 6, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si judicibus ipsis aut gloriae damnatio rei aut deformitati futura absolutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">dat. gerund</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen impedimento id rebus gerundis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 24</bibl></cit> (for a full account of this dative, v. Roby, Gram. 2, praef. pp. xxv.-lvi., and § 1158 sq.).—</sense><sense id="n46529.53" n="7" level="3"> Esse ad aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to be of use for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to serve for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum murteum est ad alvum crudam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">completae naves taedā et pice reliquisque rebus quae sunt ad incendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valvae, quae olim ad ornandum templum erant maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:56:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 56, § 124</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46529.54" n="8" level="3"> Id est or hoc est, with <hi rend="ital">predic.-clause</hi> by way of explanatory addition, <hi rend="ital">that is</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is to say;</hi> sometimes also with a climax in the sense, <hi rend="ital">which is as much as to say</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">which is the same thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed domum redeamus, id est ad nostros revertamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:172" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi in scenā, id est in contione verum valet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meos amicos, in quibus est studium, in Graeciam mitto, id est ad Graecos ire jubeo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Epicurum, id est si Democritum probarem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (sapiens) aegritudine opprimatur, id est miseriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:13:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 13, 27</bibl></cit>: a parte negotiali, hoc est <foreign lang="greek">pragmatikh=|,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in bona tua invasero, hoc est, cum te docuero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46529.55" n="9" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with Greek <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> pleonastically: <cit><quote lang="la">esse dederat monumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 572</bibl></cit> (cf.: <foreign lang="greek">dw=ke ceinh+ion ei\=nai,</foreign> Hom. Il. 10, 269).</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n46530" type="main" key="sum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum</orth> = eum, Enn. ap. Fest., v. is.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46531" type="main" key="sum3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-</orth> <itype>in composition</itype>, for sub before m; v. sub <sense id="n46531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sumen: <entryFree id="n46532" type="main" key="su_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūmen</orth>, <itype>inis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from sugimen, sugmen, from sugo</etym>, <sense id="n46532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breast</hi>, of women (syn.: uber, mamma). </sense><sense id="n46532.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46532.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: manus lactanti in sumine sidat, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 458, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46532.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a sow</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s udder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the paps of a sow</hi> (esteemed a delicacy by the Romans): <cit><quote lang="la">pernam, abdomen, sumen, suis glandium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 84, § 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:44:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 44, 1</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n46532.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:73" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 73</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46532.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the fat part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the richest portion</hi>: (Caesar Vopiscus) campos Roseae Italiae dixit esse sumen, Varr R. R. 1, 7, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suminatus: <entryFree id="n46533" type="main" key="su_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sumen</etym>, <sense id="n46533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a sow</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s udder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that has the paps on</hi> (post-class.): caro, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the paps</hi> or <hi rend="ital">udder of a sow</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 73</bibl>. sus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a sow</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
summa: <entryFree id="n46534" type="main" key="summa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. res; old <sense id="n46534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> summai, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:984" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 984</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:679" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 679</bibl>) [summus, v. superus]. </sense><sense id="n46534.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, that which is highest in any thing, <hi rend="ital">the top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surface</hi> (postAug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">testudines evectae in summā pelagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 10, 12, § 35</bibl></cit> (cf. summus, I. s. v. superus).—</sense><sense id="n46534.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, that which is most important or prominent in any thing, <hi rend="ital">the main thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principal matter; the sum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfection</hi> </sense><sense id="n46534.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">leges a me edentur non perfectae ... sed ipsae summae rerum atque sententiae,</quote> <trans><tr>the main points</tr>, <tr>chief particulars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus rei satis erit summam dixisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:20:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 20, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hac infinitā licentiā haec summa cogitur, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectis rerum summis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 29, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec summa est, hic nostri nuntius esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa est, si curaveris, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:75:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 75, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc summa judicii causaque tota consistit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam ignominiam ad summam universi belli pertinere ratus,</quote> <trans><tr>to the issue of the whole war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 17, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec belli summa nefandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 572</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solus summam habet hic apud nos,</quote> <trans><tr>the first place</tr>, <tr>pre-eminence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vobis summam ordinis consiliique concedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam alicui rei dare,</quote> <trans><tr>perfection</tr>, <tr>culmination</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: 5, 10, 72; 11, 2, 41; 12, 1, 20: remittendo de summā quisque juris. <hi rend="ital">strict</hi> or <hi rend="ital">extreme</hi> <cb n="SUMM" /> <hi rend="ital">right</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 43, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46534.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46534.5" n="1" level="3"> Of a reckoning of numbers, <hi rend="ital">the amount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sum total</hi>, including each of the single items, as if counted: quid, tu, inquam, soles, cum rationem a dispensatore accipis, si aera singula probasti, summam, quae ex his confecta sit, non probare? Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 193, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">addendo deducendoque videre, quae reliqui summa fiat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Py.</hi> Quanta istaec hominum summa est? <hi rend="ital">Ar.</hi> Septem milia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum magno numero ex omni populi summa separato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subducamus summam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53, § 131</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46534.6" n="2" level="3"> Of money, <hi rend="ital">a sum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amount.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46534.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">pecuniae</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae summam quantam imperaverit, parum convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 16, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae etiam par prope summa fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 23, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa pecuniae signatae fuit talentūm duo milia et sexcenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accessit ad hanc pecuniae summam sex milia talantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae summa homines movit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 61, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 11, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:46:16" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 46, 16</bibl>; 42, 62, 14; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">census equestrem Summam nummorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob parvam pecuniae summam erogatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:8:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46534.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <hi rend="ital">pecuniae</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de summā nihil decedet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac summā redempti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:61:2" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 61, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marcellus decem pondo auri et argenti ad summam sestertii decies in aerarium rettulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quācumque summā tradet luxuriae domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 4, 44</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">creditor totius summae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:117" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actor summarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46534.9" n="3" level="3"> Without reference to a count, <hi rend="ital">the sum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the whole</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de summā mali detrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:23:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa cogitationum mearum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meorum maerorum atque amorum summam edictavi tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo ex hac infinita licentiā haec summa cogitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proposita vitae ejus velut summa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae summa brevis spem nos vetat incohare longam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: summarum summa est aeterna, <hi rend="ital">the sum of all sums</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sum of all things</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the universe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 361</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">summa summarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 40:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 40, 13</bibl>; and: summa summaï, Lucr 6, 679. — </sense><sense id="n46534.10" n="4" level="3"> Adverb. </sense><sense id="n46534.11" n="(a)" level="5"> Ad summam, <hi rend="ital">on the whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a word</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille affirmabat ... ad summam: non posse istaec sic abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad summam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 42, 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 106</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:79" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46534.12" n="(b)" level="5"> In summā, <hi rend="ital">in all</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Drusus erat de praevaricatione a tribunis aerariis absolutus, in summā quattuor sententiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 22, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 11, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni summā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n46534.13" n="(g)" level="5"> In summā, <hi rend="ital">at last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finally</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">diu colluctatus est: in summā victus occumbit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:8:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1:8" default="NO">22, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:1:8" default="NO">37, 1, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46534.14" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the whole</hi> (opp. a part): <cit><quote lang="la">magnam res diligentiam requirebat, non in summā exercitus tuenda, sed in singulis militibus conservandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">summa exercitus salva,</quote> <trans><tr>the main body of the army</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solet quaedam esse partium brevitas, quae longam tamen efficit summam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam partibus blandiuntur, sed in summam non consentiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46534.15" n="2" level="3"> That which relates to the whole, as opp. to a part; with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supreme</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Remi dicebant) ad hunc (regem) totius belli summam omnium voluntate deferri,</quote> <trans><tr>the command in chief</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque de summā belli suum judicium sed imperatoris esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum penes unum est omnium summa rerum, regem illum unum vocamus,</quote> <trans><tr>authority over all affairs</tr>, <tr>the supreme power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is, qui summam rerum administrabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad te summa solum, Phormio, rerum redit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summam rerum consulere,</quote> <trans><tr>for the general interest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad discrimen summa rerum adducta,</quote> <trans><tr>to a general engagement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discrimen summae rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos penes summam consilii voluit esse, cum imperii summam rex teneret,</quote> <trans><tr>the sole command</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:28:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 28, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vobis summam ordinis consiliique concedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod penes eos (Bituriges), si id oppidum retinuissent, summam victoriae constare intellegebant,</quote> <trans><tr>the whole credit of the victory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 21</bibl></cit>; so, victoriae, <cb n="SUMM" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 82</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa ducum, Atri des,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 9, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
summaestus: <entryFree id="n46535" type="hapax" key="summaestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-maestus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>a</itype>, um. <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat sorrowful</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
summalis: <entryFree id="n46536" type="main" key="summa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>summa</etym>, <sense id="n46536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing a sum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whole</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 31</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">summālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfectly</hi>, Primas. in Coloss. 1.</sense></entryFree>
summanalia: <entryFree id="n46537" type="gloss" key="Summa_na_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Summānālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, v. Summanus.</entryFree>
summanans: <entryFree id="n46538" type="hapax" key="summa_nans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-mānans</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [mano], <sense id="n46538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing beneath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua sub terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
summanes: <entryFree id="n46539" type="main" key="Summa_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Summānes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Subm-</orth>), <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of inferior deities</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
summano: <entryFree id="n46540" type="main" key="summa_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summāno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <sense id="n46540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">n</hi> [sub-mano]. </sense><sense id="n46540.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trickle under</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46540.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wet somewhat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta mea, ubi obdormivi ebrius, Summano (with a play on the name Summanus, i. e. Pluto),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 46</bibl></cit> (v. the passage in connection).</sense></entryFree>
summanus: <entryFree id="n46541" type="main" key="Summa_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Summānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Subm-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman deity to whom nocturnal lightnings were asscribed</hi>, but whose precise nature was unknown even to Ovid; acc. to Mart. Cap. i. q. <hi rend="ital">Pluto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:731" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 731</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 10, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 52, 53, § 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:57" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 14, § 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 3</bibl> Orell.; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 23; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1466</bibl>; v. Merkel ad Ov. F. p. ccviii.—Hence: Summanalia liba farinacea in modum rotae ficta, Fest. pp. 348 and 349 Müll. (<hi rend="ital">offered in sacrifice to Summanus</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
summara: <entryFree id="n46542" type="main" key="Summara"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Summara</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Ethiopia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 193</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
summarium: <entryFree id="n46543" type="gloss" key="summa_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>summa</etym>, <sense id="n46543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a summary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">epitome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abstract</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio, quae nunc vulgo breviarium dicitur, olim, cum Latine loqueremur, summarium, vocabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 39:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 39, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
summas: <entryFree id="n46544" type="main" key="summas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of high</hi> or <hi rend="ital">noble birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high-born</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matronae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 267, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>, p. 153, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
summatim: <entryFree id="n46545" type="main" key="summa_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on the surface</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the outside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slightly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46545.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">radicem summatim eradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:48:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 48, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruere radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 6:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ablaqueare vitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib. 10:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46545.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">slightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summarily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cursorily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compendiously</hi>, etc. (class.): summatim rescribere paucis, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 296, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de re pecuariā breviter ac summatim percurram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">7: aliquid summatim perscribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid cognoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summatim breviterque componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summatim et uno tantummodo versiculo leviter attingit Vergilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(animal) constitutionem suam crasse intellegit et summatim et obscure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid attingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëticam summatim attigit,</quote> <trans><tr>slightly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:85" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 61</bibl>: summatim aestimandum judici, an bonā fide imploretur judicium, Dig 5, 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
summatus: <entryFree id="n46546" type="hapax" key="summa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chief rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supremacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sovereignty</hi>, = principatus: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium ac summatum petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1142</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
summe: <entryFree id="n46547" type="main" key="summe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. superus <sense id="n46547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
summedius: <entryFree id="n46548" type="hapax" key="summe^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-mĕdĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">middle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi> positura, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 432</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
summejo: <entryFree id="n46549" type="hapax" key="summe_jo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-mējo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make water under</hi> a thing, se, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8, 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
summejulus: <entryFree id="n46550" type="hapax" key="summe_ju^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summējŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>summejo</etym>, <sense id="n46550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes water under himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who wets his bed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
summergo: <entryFree id="n46551" type="main" key="summergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-mergo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dip</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plunge under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overwhelm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submerge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submerse.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46551.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; most freq. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">summersus equus voraginibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genera summersarum beluarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salgama semper jure summersa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: navis summersa, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum summersum in undā, Ov M. 12, 279: ipsos potuit summergere ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (saxum) tumidis submersum tunditur olim Fluctibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquot procellis summersi paene sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summersas obrue puppes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: omnes quondam terrae <pb n="1801" /> <cb n="SUMM" /> submersae profundo fuerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:17" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1, 17</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46551.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">virtus summersa tenebris, Claud. lV. Cons. Hon. 221: publicatam summergere lectionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to suppress</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
